task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 290°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the building’s roofline and base clearly to estimate height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying on the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and up, so I should rotate back to the west-northwest (~290°) while keeping an upward pitch to capture the roofline.
I’m aligned to ~290° but need the full vertical extent, so I should tilt up to include the roof while keeping the building centered.
The heading keeps snapping back to 0°, so I should explicitly rotate to 290° while staying pitched up to view the top of the building.
To estimate height I need a stable view of the roofline, so I’ll look up at the same heading again.
Since pitching up is forcing the view to 0°, I should first rotate to the correct westward heading (290°) at this pitch.
I’m stuck oscillating and still can’t reliably see the full façade, so I should move closer/angled to improve the building view for height estimation.
